article.headline: VMI 82, Charleston Southern 76
article.story: LEXINGTON, Va. -- Chavis Holmes notched a double-double, scoring 33 points and grabbing 12 rebounds to lead Virginia Military Institute in an 82-76 win over Charleston Southern on Monday night. The win clinched the Keydets' (20-4, 11-2 Big South Conference) fourth 20-win season all-time, and set a new VMI record for Big South victories in a season. This Keydets team broke a tie with the 1995-96 team, which held the previous best of 10 wins. Ron Burks added 12 points for VMI, going 2-for-2 from beyond the arc. Jamarco Warren led the Buccaneers (7-16, 2-10) with 21 points, while Omar Carter scored 13 and notched 15 rebounds. The Buccaneers led by two points at the break, and led 72-70 with 4:14 remaining before VMI closed the half on a game-winning 16-4 run. Holmes hit four free throws and grabbed three boards in the spurt.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.
